results.title: Dr Plughole
results.brief_description: Matthew’s evening bath is interrupted by a visit from the water wizard Dr. Plughole. Combining animation and live action into comic adventure, “Dr. Plughole” shows young Matthew how exciting the water cycle is and how important it is for our everyday lives. Principles covered are evaporation, condensation and precipitation.

results.title: Dr Petiot
results.creator_credit: MS Productions, Sara Films, Cine 5, Canal+, Alain Sarde, Philippe Chapelier-Dehesdin and Christian de Chalonge
results.brief_description: Michel Serrault gives an extraordinary perfomance as ‘Dr Petiot’, a serial killer who lured Jews into his trap by offering them protection from the Nazis. The film’s expressionistic quality, emphasised by the heavy make-up of Petiot, and the deep focus photography, gives the film a nightmare quality reminiscent of the early German silent horror films. Indeed the film opens with scenes from one such film, plunging us into a world of evil. Based on a true character, Serrault’s perfomance is chilling.

results.title: Dr Mabuse: the fatal passions
results.brief_description: The feature version of the two-part ‘Dr Mabuse: The Gambler’ edited into one movie. Dr. Mabuse is a master criminal and overlord of the social chaos in Berlin who uses hypnosis, disguise and deception in his quest for wealth and power. As much a social portrait as a thriller, this is an early example of the suitability of the thriller genre as a vehicle for Lang’s world view, a world in which nothing is as it seems, where danger lurks beneath the most seemingly normal circumstances and objects, and individual destinies are controlled and threatened by mysterious and powerful forces. This is an early demonstration of a key Langian theme: the complete unreliability of appearances. With English intertitles and musical accompaniment. Cast includes Rudolf Klein-Rogge, Ause Egdse Nissem, Paul Richter, Bernhard Goetzke. Reference: Julian Petley, BFI Distribution Library Catalogue. WITH MUSICAL SOUNDTRACK.

results.title: Dr Leakey and the dawn of man
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Nicolas Noxon
results.brief_description: Highlights the discoveries of Dr Leakey and their implications for the study of human origins. Traces the development of the first theories about both the emergence of humans and their place of origin and examines the application of modern technology to the study of anthropology. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Dr Fred D. Miller and the gateway to health
results.creator_credit: John Ott Pictures, John Ott and Robert Edmonds
results.brief_description: General physical health and hygiene practices as the basis of good dental health. A practising dentist shows how errors of diet and poor dental hygiene lead to poor teeth and avoidable cavities. Patients who have eaten the right foods all their lives and made a practice of finishing a meal with a crisp fruit have near-perfect teeth when in their fifties.

results.title: Dr Coppelius = El Fantastico mundo del Dr Coppelius
results.creator_credit: Copelia, Frank J Hales Productions, Frank J. Hale and Ted Kneeland
results.brief_description: Based on the ballet Coppelia this film adaptation focuses more on the Doctor and his wonderful mechanical dolls as the central plot to the story rather than on Coppelia, the doll itself. The principal characters of the story are: Dr Coppelius (played by actor Walter Slezak), a practical joker who dabbles in witchcraft and sorcery and loves making life-like mechanical dolls, Franz (Caj Selling) the young lover who does not realise that the beautiful Coppelia is one of the Doctor’s mechanical dolls, Swanhilda (Claudia Corday), Franz’s bride-to-be, and Brigitta (Eileen Elliott), the tavern maid secretly in love with Dr Coppelius. The story is based on an original libretto by Charles Nuitter and music by Leo Delibes. Features the members of the Ballet of the Gran Teatro Del Liceo of Barcelone and the International Cine Ballet and the Orchestra of the Gran Teatro Del Liceo of Barcelone under the direction of Adrian Sardo.

results.title: Downhill
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robin Spry and Tom Daly
results.brief_description: Actor Michael Kane stars in this brief winter romance filmed partly in the dazzling outdoor splendor of a Laurentian ski resort and partly in the cardiac wing of a city hospital. It is the story of a man’s second youth, the time in his middle years when he overstrains his passion for life and love. A stolen weekend, and the inevitable reckoning; between these two, the hills themselves serve the drama like members of the cast.

results.title: Down to the sea
results.creator_credit: Fisheries Research Board of Canada, ONF | NFB and Giles Walker
results.brief_description: Opening with the poignant story of a herring fisherman whose life’s work is endangered by man’s careless exploitation of the living resources of the sea, this film looks at the frontiers of technology in fisheries research. Emphasises the use of undersea technology, including scuba diving, underwater sleds, and a new two-man submarine of revolutionary design.

results.title: Down to Sussex
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Edgar H. Anstey and Kenneth J. Fairbairn
results.brief_description: South Down and Weald - open space and green woodland. This is Sussex, a county rich in scenic beauty. History shows itself everywhere, right back to the threshold of legend - The Long Man of Wilmington and Chanctonbury Ring. All this the present day traveller can see and enjoy, together with the present day delights of Petworth Show, Goodwood Races, polo at Cowdray Park, Glyndebourne and the Sussex Coast. Narrated by Peter Halliday.
